reviews.text: Booked this after reading reivews,and being forewarned of a potantial language barrier. Pension is located up a flight of stairs to reception desk. Man at front desk aims to please, very welcoming, and clearly used to broken tourist spanish and sign language. Rooms basic but clean, a no frills night sleep. Beware water and juice at front desk very expensive (2euro for water) otherwise a good room for good price. I drove in late and left eArly so cant comment on the neighborhood. Front desk man said free parkingon street where blue ilnes drawn till 9 am, which I found helpful.
reviews.title: good deal for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -/+ The nice old man at the reception desk doesn't speak English but he always smiles and tries to help.
reviews.title: Real Hospitality in a fantastic Spanish City

reviews.text: + The breakfast is served in a cafe downstairs. Pay in advance, it's a couple of cents cheaper. Each day in the morning you'll receive a ticket which you have to show at the cafe. I don't think the waitress speaks English (at that point I gave up speaking English which no one around understood anyway and tried to improvise in Spanish). The breakfast consists of a glass of orange juice, two big toasts with tomato paste (or some other topping) and a coffee. Okay for the price (about 2 euros). Order, sit outside, a nice waiter will bring you the stuff.
reviews.title: A Lonely Planet Budget Recommendation,However...
